perturbation.original_text: Client will use reasonable efforts to assist Intuit in implementing the promotional placements and advertising described in the Agreement.  The parties recognize that the Launch Date can be met only if Client provides final versions of all Client Graphics, text, Banner Advertisements and other promotional media and valid URL links necessary to implement the promotional placements and
perturbation.changed_text: Client will endeavor, where practical, to assist Intuit in implementing the promotional placements and advertising described in the Agreement. The parties acknowledge that the Launch Date may be met if Client attempts to provide final versions of Client Graphics, text, Banner Advertisements and other promotional media and URL links that are reasonably valid to implement the promotional placements and
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a reasonable standard, requiring client use reasonable efforts to assist in implementation, and requires the parties to recognize that certain things are required to meet the Launch Date. The modified text softens 'will use reasonable efforts' to 'will endeavor, where practical', making the level of effort discretionary. Replacing 'can be met only if' with 'may be met if' significantly lowers the threshold for meeting the Launch Date. The use of 'attempts' with 'reasonably valid' also weakens the requirement for quality. This undermines a material term of the agreement, thus creating non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Law - Material Breach

perturbation.original_text: Intuit will maintain accurate records with respect to the calculation of Impressions delivered pursuant to this Agreement. Client may, upon no less than thirty (30) days prior written notice to Intuit, cause an independent Certified Public Accountant to inspect all relevant records of Intuit upon which the calculation of Impressions under the Usage Reports are based during Client's normal business hours. The fees charged by such Certified Public Accountant in connection with the inspection will be paid by Client unless the number of Impressions are determined to have been less than ninety-five percent (95%) of the Impressions due to Client, in which case Client will be responsible for the payment of the reasonable fees for such inspection.   In addition, if the audit reveals such shortfall in the number of Impressions generated, Intuit shall continue to display Client's Banner Advertisements, Client Graphics, Sponsor Client Graphics and Links on the Intuit Sites as set forth herein.  The audit rights set forth herein shall continue for one (1) year following the termination of this Agreement for any reason.  No such audit may occur more than once a year during the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: Intuit will maintain records with respect to Impressions delivered pursuant to this Agreement. Client may, with notification to Intuit, request an audit. The fees charged by the auditor in connection with the inspection will be addressed by the client. If the audit reveals a shortfall in Impressions generated, Intuit may continue to display Client's Advertisements.  The audit rights set forth herein shall continue following the termination of this Agreement.  No such audit may occur more than once a year during the Term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text sets forth the requirement to maintain 'accurate' records and it also allows client to 'cause an independent Certified Public Accountant to inspect all relevant records'. It states that 'In addition, if the audit reveals such shortfall in the number of Impressions generated, Intuit shall continue to display Client's Banner Advertisements'. The modified text removes 'accurate', removes the requirement that the auditor be 'independent', as well as the 'all relevant records' and removes the 30 days written notice. The modified text also states that Intuit 'may' instead of 'shall' continue to display the advertisement. This change weakens the auditing powers and creates ambiguity around the procedure, potentially hindering the client's ability to verify impression counts. The removal of '95% of the Impressions due to Client' creates further ambiguity about the trigger point for Intuit to continue displaying ads. The original text provides an recourse. This change introduces ambiguity in the client's ability to get recourse if Intuit has a shortfall on impressions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Law - Lack of Recourse

perturbation.original_text: Client will pay Intuit [***] of the Net Transaction Revenues it receives from each New Customer acquired by Client above the Minimum Customer Number ("Transaction Fee").  Within fifteen (15) days after the end of each month, Client will provide a monthly report (the "Transaction Fee Report") to Intuit. The Transaction Fee Report will report the Net Transaction Revenue and Transaction Fees for such month. All Transaction Fees due per the Transaction Fee Report will be paid with the submission of such Report.
perturbation.changed_text: Client will pay Intuit a percentage of Net Transaction Revenues it receives from each New Customer acquired by Client. Within a reasonable timeframe, Client will provide a report to Intuit. The report will generally summarize Net Transaction Revenue and Fees. Transaction Fees will be paid after the report is compiled.
perturbation.explanation: The original text contains fixed guidelines of the process. The modified text introduces ambiguity into the transaction payments. 'Reasonable timeframe' doesn't stipulate how long Client has to create report. Removing '15 days' adds ambiguity. All of the following phrases add ambiguity and make the text open to interpretation: 'percentage' doesn't state what percentage to pay, 'generally summarize' doesn't provide detail of report, and 'after the report is compiled' doesn't provide how long Client has to pay fees.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract Law - Lack of Specificity
